text: Anyway I think that's quite enough from me today. This is long-winded even by my gasbag standards and I have NOT EVEN finished cup one of my coffee. Thank you again to everyone for your support -- new Sullyville newsletter going up today I think you will like about Palestine!

Folks who bring this stuff up to try to hurt me deserve sympathy, too. Every single one of them, in my experience, is dealing with the same shame & bad feelings about things they did (or do) &, imo, are dealing with it in an unhealthy way by going after someone who cast that off.

I want to thank everyone who stood up for me & expressed kind words. The outpouring of support means more than I can express. If you at all relate to being that wounded, angry younger me, I want to let you know you can change & help others. You don't have to keep hating yourself.

It appears @ggreenwald has deleted his slanderous tweet about me deploying a 4chan collage like the web Charlie in Always Sunny makes. I am so pleased that if stand up to a bully, people will strongly support you & the bully will slink away quietly. https://t.co/Hds0WsgIGg

@Bro_Pair huh weird the anti-cancel culture god-warrior Glemm seems to have deleted the tweet. im sure, as an ethical journalist with high professional standards he will note his mistake and not just pretend he never tried to do this, like every other shitty thing hes publicly done.

Not content to have defended a crew of fascists endangering activists this past week, Glenn Greenwald turns his attention to me, your humble tweeter, by tweeting out the utterly deranged collage assembled & quite possibly written by a 4chan neo-Nazi. I think this is defamatory?? https://t.co/kEnUvTeFEU
